summary:
A focused and highly competent Electrical Engineer working with Bayer US LLC- Radiology department and an MSEE graduate with experience in Electronics and Embedded Systems with PCB design. Published author with working knowledge of research and development for best practices of Electronics design.

As a MSEE student as part of my master's degree, I completed a thesis work titled "Trauma Detection Personal Locator Beacon System." In this work, I developed a system for the detection of trauma to automatically activate a distress signal (i.e. PLB systems) to get medical help for people left incapacitated or unconscious in remote areas. This involved the integration of various bioelectronic systems into an embedded device for the signal processing and analysis of the data. This work included the design, testing, and debugging of the system through PCB design and software implementation.

A few of my technical skills include:
- Analog/Digital circuit design, signal conditioning circuits
- Circuit simulation tools: PSpice and Proteus
- AutoDesk Eagle, DipTrace
- MATLAB/Simulink
- Embedded C/C++
- Microcontrollers: PIC18, PIC16 and ATmega series
- Embedded IDEs: MPLab IDE, MPLab IPE, AVR Studio, Arduino
- Serial communication protocols: UART, I2C and SPI
- Electrical equipment operation: Oscilloscopes, Function Generators, Multimeters, Power supplies, 
  Soldering

Contact Information:
Email: sakshisharma180692@gmail.com

currentPositions.description:
• Analyzed schematics of many systems and subsystems assemblies. Performed testing and troubleshooting of MCU PCB using schematics, multimeter and oscilloscope.
• Developed Proof of Concept for waste container, compared with legacy product and determined the feasibility for new project. Worked on integrating FDC1004 capacitive sensor with Arduino Uno. Modified the code, tested, and calibrated the capacitive sensor. Optimized the legacy product capacitive sensor using various configurations and differential measurements.
• Worked on Derating Analysis for few PCBA’s derating the components in the PCB’s.
currentPositions.title: Electrical Engineer

projects.description:
Developed a centralized telemetry system using Zigbee technology. This system detected and transmitted data related to electrocardiograms (ECG), heart rates, and body temperatures of patients using Zigbee module. 

Data was displayed on a central monitor using MATLAB, a Zigbee module, and a universal asynchronous receiver-transmitter (UART) communication protocol.

Due to the long range and power-efficient operation of Zigbee, this system was designed as a cost-effective alternative to other wireless or wired telemetry systems in a clinical setting.
projects.title: Zigbee Based Centralised Patient Monitoring System

projects.description: Designed and built a Bluetooth-controlled toy car using an HC-05 Bluetooth module, universal asynchronous receiver-transmitter (UART) communication protocol and a PIC18F4550 microcontroller.
projects.title: Bluetooth Controlled Vehicular System

projects.description:
Measured Glucose level of a person using Near Infrared LED and gas sensor. Near Infrared LED having wavelength of 1500 nm Near Infrared radiations were passed through blood and received by photodiode;  to measure glucose level in the blood.

MQ-6 gas sensor was also used to measure Acetone level in blood; this sensor measured acetone by calculating Voltage of the load and resistance of the sensor. It was found Glucose concentration increased by increasing voltage across the load.  

Arduino Platform was used to read the data from the signal conditioning circuit and MQ-6 gas sensor. 

Linear regression analysis for both methods was done in Excel.
projects.title: Glucose Monitoring Through Non-Invasive Method

projects.description:
Analyzed affective states in humans using Electroencephalogram signals and facial expression analyses.

Calculated focus and excitement levels using EEG signals. EEG signals were recorded, retrieved, and written in an Excel file in real time using Emotiv BCI and Cortex UI software.

Facial expressions of participants were captured using a webcam and affective states were analyzed using AFFDEX SDK.

Readings were compared before and after watching the stimulus.
projects.title: Real-Time EEG Based Affective States Recognition and Facial Expression Analysis Using Multimedia

projects.description:
Designed, tested and debugged active filter circuits on breadboard and developed PCB board for measuring a patient’s ECG, heart rate and body temperature using DipTrace.

Coded in AVR Studio using ATmega16 microcontroller to display data on LCD and Oscilloscope using universal asynchronous receiver-transmitter (UART) communication protocol. 

Streamed data to a Raspberry Pi server for viewing with a browser-based graphing tool (PLOTLY) to provide easy access to patient data.
projects.title: Remote Monitoring of ECG and Body Temperature Signals

projects.description:
Developed a wrist-mounted multi-sensor personal locator beacon that automatically activates in 
 the event of serious trauma to its wearer. This was achieved using a combination of sensors that could measure skin conductance, oxygen saturation (SpO2), heart rate, body temperature, and freefall/impact occurrence.

Designed the acquisition, filtration, and amplification circuits, Simulated active filter circuits using PSpice; tested and debugged the full system on breadboard using Embedded System.

Coded in MPLAB X IDE using a PIC18LF microcontroller to extract data on the serial console named PuTTY through a universal asynchronous receiver-transmitter (UART) and I²C communication protocols.

Designed the full system schematics and footprint (including the power supply and battery charging modules) using Autodesk EAGLE.
projects.title: GRADUATE THESIS |  TRAUMA DETECTION PERSONAL LOCATOR BEACON (PLB)

headline: Electrical Engineer| Embedded Software Engineer| Hardware Engineer| Firmware Engineer| Embedded System Engineer

message.text:
Hi everyone, I am looking for new roles as Electrical Engineer/Hardware Engineer/ Embedded Engineer. If anyone has any leads/connections/opportunities, please let me know. Thanks!
